hints.label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
hints.title: N-Uniform Bounded Perturbation from Adaptive Force
hints.content:
1380: :label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
1381: 
1382: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ contributes a bounded perturbation to the drift of $V_{\text{total}}$. There exists a **ρ-dependent but N-uniform constant** $K_F(\rho) < \infty$ such that:
1383: 
1384: $$
1385: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}(S), \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S) \right\rangle \right| \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1)
1386: 
1387: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1377: ### 6.2. Boundedness of the Adaptive Force Contribution
1378: 
1379: :::{prf:lemma} N-Uniform Bounded Perturbation from Adaptive Force
1380: :label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
1381: 
1382: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ contributes a bounded perturbation to the drift of $V_{\text{total}}$. There exists a **ρ-dependent but N-uniform constant** $K_F(\rho) < \infty$ such that:
1383: 
1384: $$
1385: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}(S), \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S) \right\rangle \right| \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1)
1386: 
1387: $$
1388:

hints.label: proof-lem-adaptive-force-bounded
hints.content:
1393: :label: proof-lem-adaptive-force-bounded
1394: 
1395: By the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality:
1396: 
1397: $$
1398: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}, \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} \right\rangle \right| \le \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\| \cdot \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\|
1399: 
1400: $$
1401: 
1402: **Step 1: N-Uniform Bound on $\|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\|$.** By **Appendix A, Theorem A.1** (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`), the C¹ regularity of the ρ-localized fitness potential establishes that:
1403: 
1404: $$
1405: \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S)\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](S)\| \le \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)
1406: 
1407: $$
1408: 
1409: where $F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = O(1/\rho)$ is the **N-uniform** explicit bound derived in the appendix through rigorous chain rule analysis and the telescoping property of normalized localization weights.
1410: 
1411: **Step 2: Polynomial growth of $\|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\|$.** The Lyapunov function is:
1412: 
1413: $$
1414: V_{\text{total}}(S) = \alpha_x V_{\text{Var},x} + \alpha_v V_{\text{Var},v} + \alpha_D V_{\text{Mean},D} + \alpha_R V_{\text{Mean},R}
1415: 
1416: $$
1417: 
1418: Each component is a quadratic or linear function of the particle positions and velocities. For example:
1419: 
1420: $$
1421: V_{\text{Var},x} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \|x_i - \bar{x}\|^2
1422: 
1423: $$
1424: 
1425: Its gradient with respect to $x_i$ is:
1426: 
1427: $$
1428: \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{Var},x} = \frac{2}{N} (x_i - \bar{x})
1429: 
1430: $$
1431: 
1432: Thus:
1433: 
1434: $$
1435: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{Var},x}\| \le \frac{2}{N} \|x_i - \bar{x}\| \le \frac{2}{\sqrt{N}} \sqrt{V_{\text{Var},x}}
1436: 
1437: $$
1438: 
1439: Summing over all particles and components:
1440: 
1441: $$
1442: \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\|^2 \le C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)
1443: 
1444: $$
1445: 
1446: for some constant $C_{\nabla}$ depending on the weights $\alpha_x, \alpha_v, \alpha_D, \alpha_R$.
1447: 
1448: **Step 3: Combine.** Therefore:
1449: 
1450: $$
1451: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}, \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} \right\rangle \right| \le \sqrt{C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)} \cdot \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}} + 1)
1452: 
1453: $$

hints.label: lem-viscous-dissipative
hints.title: Dissipative Contribution from Viscous Force
hints.content:
1476: :label: lem-viscous-dissipative
1477: 
1478: The normalized viscous force
1479: 
1480: $$
1481: \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}} = \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i)
1482: 
1483: $$
1484: 
1485: contributes a **negative** (dissipative) term to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{Var},v}$:
1486: 
1487: $$
1488: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\nu \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) \le 0
1489: 
1490: $$
1491: 
1492: where
1493: 
1494: $$
1495: \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) := \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \ge 0
1496: 
1497: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1473: ### 6.3. Dissipativity of the Viscous Force
1474: 
1475: :::{prf:lemma} Dissipative Contribution from Viscous Force
1476: :label: lem-viscous-dissipative
1477: 
1478: The normalized viscous force
1479: 
1480: $$
1481: \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}} = \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i)
1482: 
1483: $$
1484: 
1485: contributes a **negative** (dissipative) term to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{Var},v}$:
1486: 
1487: $$
1488: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\nu \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) \le 0
1489: 
1490: $$
1491: 
1492: where
1493: 
1494: $$
1495: \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) := \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \ge 0
1496: 
1497: $$
1498:

hints.label: proof-lem-viscous-dissipative
hints.content:
1503: :label: proof-lem-viscous-dissipative
1504: 
1505: The velocity variance is:
1506: 
1507: $$
1508: V_{\text{Var},v} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2
1509: 
1510: $$
1511: 
1512: From the Stratonovich chain rule (Theorem [](#thm-strat-chain)), the contribution of the normalized viscous force to the drift is:
1513: 
1514: $$
1515: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = \sum_{i=1}^N \left\langle \nabla_{v_i} V_{\text{Var},v}, \, \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i) \right\rangle
1516: 
1517: $$
1518: 
1519: Since $\nabla_{v_i} V_{\text{Var},v} = \frac{2}{N}(v_i - \bar{v})$:
1520: 
1521: $$
1522: \begin{aligned}
1523: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{2\nu}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \frac{1}{\deg(i)} \sum_{j \neq i} K(x_i - x_j) \langle v_i - \bar{v}, \, v_j - v_i \rangle
1524: \end{aligned}
1525: 
1526: $$
1527: 
1528: **Key observation:** We use the **antisymmetric pairing structure** of $(v_j - v_i)$.
1529: 
1530: Define the symmetric weight matrix $W_{ij} = K(x_i - x_j)$. Since the sum over all pairs can be symmetrized:
1531: 
1532: $$
1533: \begin{aligned}
1534: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle}{\deg(i)} + \frac{\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle}{\deg(j)} \right]
1535: \end{aligned}
1536: 
1537: $$
1538: 
1539: Using $\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle = -\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle$:
1540: 
1541: $$
1542: = \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} - \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle
1543: 
1544: $$
1545: 
1546: Expanding $\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle = -\|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$ and using the identity $\|v_i - v_j\|^2 = \|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \|v_j - \bar{v}\|^2 - 2\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$, we obtain after algebraic manipulation:
1547: 
1548: $$
1549: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \le 0
1550: 
1551: $$

1502: :::{prf:proof}

1511: 
1512: From the Stratonovich chain rule (Theorem [](#thm-strat-chain)), the contribution of the normalized viscous force to the drift is:

1516: 
1517: $$
1518: 
1519: Since $\nabla_{v_i} V_{\text{Var},v} = \frac{2}{N}(v_i - \bar{v})$:
1520: 
1521: $$
1522: \begin{aligned}
1523: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{2\nu}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \frac{1}{\deg(i)} \sum_{j \neq i} K(x_i - x_j) \langle v_i - \bar{v}, \, v_j - v_i \rangle
1524: \end{aligned}
1525: 
1526: $$
1527: 
1528: **Key observation:** We use the **antisymmetric pairing structure** of $(v_j - v_i)$.
1529: 
1530: Define the symmetric weight matrix $W_{ij} = K(x_i - x_j)$. Since the sum over all pairs can be symmetrized:
1531: 
1532: $$
1533: \begin{aligned}
1534: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle}{\deg(i)} + \frac{\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle}{\deg(j)} \right]
1535: \end{aligned}
1536: 
1537: $$
1538: 
1539: Using $\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle = -\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle$:
1540: 
1541: $$
1542: = \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} - \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle
1543: 
1544: $$
1545: 
1546: Expanding $\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle = -\|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$ and using the identity $\|v_i - v_j\|^2 = \|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \|v_j - \bar{v}\|^2 - 2\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$, we obtain after algebraic manipulation:
1547: 
1548: $$
1549: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \le 0
1550: 
1551: $$

hints.label: lem-diffusion-bounded
hints.title: Bounded Change from Adaptive Diffusion
hints.content:
1565: :label: lem-diffusion-bounded
1566: 
1567: Replacing the constant diffusion $\sigma I$ with the adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x, S)$ results in a bounded change to the drift. The diffusion contribution $A_{\text{diff}}(S)$ from Definition [](#def-strat-drift) satisfies:
1568: 
1569: $$
1570: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff}} < \infty
1571: 
1572: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1562: ### 6.4. Boundedness of the Diffusion Perturbation
1563: 
1564: :::{prf:lemma} Bounded Change from Adaptive Diffusion
1565: :label: lem-diffusion-bounded
1566: 
1567: Replacing the constant diffusion $\sigma I$ with the adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x, S)$ results in a bounded change to the drift. The diffusion contribution $A_{\text{diff}}(S)$ from Definition [](#def-strat-drift) satisfies:
1568: 
1569: $$
1570: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff}} < \infty
1571: 
1572: $$
1573:

hints.label: proof-lem-diffusion-bounded
hints.content:
1578: :label: proof-lem-diffusion-bounded
1579: 
1580: Recall from Definition [](#def-strat-drift):
1581: 
1582: $$
1583: A_{\text{diff}}(S) = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^d \left[ (\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) - \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \right]
1584: 
1585: $$
1586: 
1587: where $\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}}$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$.
1588: 
1589: **Step 1: Bound the Stratonovich second-order term.** The term $(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V)$ is a directional second derivative. By the chain rule:
1590: 
1591: $$
1592: (\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) = \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle + \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle
1593: 
1594: $$
1595: 
1596: The first term is bounded using the Hessian of $V$:
1597: 
1598: $$
1599: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle \right| \le \|\sigma_{ij}\|^2 \|\nabla^2_{v_i} V\| \le c_{\max} \|\nabla^2 V\|
1600: 
1601: $$
1602: 
1603: by Theorem [](#thm-ueph).
1604: 
1605: The second term involves the derivative of the diffusion coefficient. Since $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}$ has bounded derivatives (it's a smooth function of the uniformly bounded $H(S)$), there exists $L_\Sigma < \infty$ such that:
1606: 
1607: $$
1608: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle \right| \le L_\Sigma \|\nabla V\|
1609: 
1610: $$
1611: 
1612: **Step 2: Bound the backbone term.** For the backbone diffusion $\sigma I$:
1613: 
1614: $$
1615: \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \le \sigma^2 \|\nabla V\|^2
1616: 
1617: $$
1618: 
1619: **Step 3: Combine.** Since $V_{\text{total}}$ is a quadratic-like function with bounded second derivatives:
1620: 
1621: $$
1622: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla\nabla}, \quad \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2}
1623: 
1624: $$
1625: 
1626: Therefore:
1627: 
1628: $$
1629: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le \frac{N d}{2} \left( c_{\max} C_{\nabla\nabla} + L_\Sigma C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2} + \sigma^2 C_{\nabla}^2 (V_{\text{total}} + 1) \right)
1630: 
1631: $$
1632: 
1633: For the perturbation analysis, we can bound this by:
1634: 
1635: $$
1636: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff,0}} + C_{\text{diff,1}} V_{\text{total}}
1637: 
1638: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1575: :::
1576: 
1577: :::{prf:proof}
1578: :label: proof-lem-diffusion-bounded
1579: 
1580: Recall from Definition [](#def-strat-drift):
1581: 
1582: $$
1583: A_{\text{diff}}(S) = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^d \left[ (\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) - \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \right]
1584: 
1585: $$
1586: 
1587: where $\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}}$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$.
1588: 
1589: **Step 1: Bound the Stratonovich second-order term.** The term $(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V)$ is a directional second derivative. By the chain rule:
1590: 
1591: $$
1592: (\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) = \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle + \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle
1593: 
1594: $$
1595: 
1596: The first term is bounded using the Hessian of $V$:
1597: 
1598: $$
1599: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle \right| \le \|\sigma_{ij}\|^2 \|\nabla^2_{v_i} V\| \le c_{\max} \|\nabla^2 V\|
1600: 
1601: $$
1602: 
1603: by Theorem [](#thm-ueph).
1604: 
1605: The second term involves the derivative of the diffusion coefficient. Since $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}$ has bounded derivatives (it's a smooth function of the uniformly bounded $H(S)$), there exists $L_\Sigma < \infty$ such that:
1606: 
1607: $$
1608: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle \right| \le L_\Sigma \|\nabla V\|
1609: 
1610: $$
1611: 
1612: **Step 2: Bound the backbone term.** For the backbone diffusion $\sigma I$:
1613: 
1614: $$
1615: \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \le \sigma^2 \|\nabla V\|^2
1616: 
1617: $$
1618: 
1619: **Step 3: Combine.** Since $V_{\text{total}}$ is a quadratic-like function with bounded second derivatives:
1620: 
1621: $$
1622: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla\nabla}, \quad \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2}
1623: 
1624: $$
1625: 
1626: Therefore:
1627: 
1628: $$
1629: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le \frac{N d}{2} \left( c_{\max} C_{\nabla\nabla} + L_\Sigma C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2} + \sigma^2 C_{\nabla}^2 (V_{\text{total}} + 1) \right)
1630: 
1631: $$
1632: 
1633: For the perturbation analysis, we can bound this by:
1634: 
1635: $$
1636: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff,0}} + C_{\text{diff,1}} V_{\text{total}}
1637: 
1638: $$
1639:

hints.label: cor-total-perturbation
hints.title: Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
hints.content:
1654: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1655: 
1656: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1657: 
1658: $$
1659: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1660: 
1661: $$
1662: 
1663: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1664: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1665: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1666: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
